definition: to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

sentences.english: They never defend anyone or anything if they can help it;
sentences.chinese: 如果能够避免，他们从不卫护任何人或任何事。

sentences.english: Reason, your viceroy in me, me should defend.
sentences.chinese: 统领我的理智，本当将我卫护。

sentences.english: The only thing he necessarily stands by is the razor .
sentences.chinese: 他唯一需要卫护的是他的剃刀。

sentences.english: The press is a guardian of the public weal.
sentences.chinese: 报刊是公共福利的卫护者。

sentences.english: "The Lord bless thee and keep thee"?
The Four Heavenly Kings and their relatives will protect him day and night.
sentences.chinese: 四大天王与诸眷属昼夜卫护。

sentences.english: Dan shall judge his people like another tribe in Israel.
sentences.chinese: 丹将如以色列的一个支派，卫护自己的人民。

definition: to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
defense of the imperial palace or of the capital/the palace guard (or a member of that unit)
forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
SS or Schutzstaffel, paramilitary organization in Nazi Germany
